intro: Sieruela bororensis, commonly known as the Bororensis Sieruela, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. Sieruela bororensis plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insects.
